revised_title: Obituary Notices of Fellows Deceased: Sydney Ringer and Sir Rubert Boyce
tldr: This article provides obituary notices for two notable fellows of the Royal Society, Sydney Ringer and Sir Rubert Boyce. Ringer was a scientific enquirer and a great physician, known for his research on the action of inorganic salts and drugs on living tissues. Boyce was a pathologist who contributed to the field of pathology and organized a laboratory of scientific pathology at the University College of Liverpool.
